poem.title: Castle of Indolence (Keep in a Cool Place)
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
First sweat dries to a crust in the breeze, breaks up on the second, like the backwash of a wave, pushed back on the shore by the next one, seasick.
You leave the novel like a tepid bath and everything's where you left it the old iron bath of your self with the novel and all its crew foundering in you, your gastric juices.
I was reading like a tourist too long, and all I wrote was like postcards home. Now the next time I write, you're going to turn the thing over like an overhead cam, a mechanical stone, and say yes, but
